thread.title: quick hits: Seals-Jones catches 1st TD pass of season, gets ejected for targeting
thread.title_full: Texas A&M quick hits: Seals-Jones catches 1st TD pass of season, gets ejected for targeting | Dallas Morning News

author: Kate Hairopoulos
title: quick hits: Seals-Jones catches 1st TD pass of season, gets ejected for targeting
text:
Texas A&M receiver Ricky Seals-Jones drew a targeting foul in the second quarter and was disqualified for the rest of the game. Officials flagged the 6-5, 240-pound sophomore for blocking Mississippi State defensive back Brandon Bryant on a first-down pass from Kyle Allen to Josh Reynolds.
Seals-Jones caught his first touchdown pass of the season, a 1-yard grab, on fourth-and-goal in the first quarter to give A&M a 7-0 lead. He had five catches for 34 yards before he was ejected.
A&M senior kicker Taylor Bertolet drilled a 55-yard field goal in the second quarter to give A&M a 17-3 lead. It was the longest by an A&M kicker since a 62-yarder in 1999. Bertolet missed a 38-yard attempt in the previous week's game against Arkansas that would've given A&M the win at the end of regulation.
Bertolet's previous career high was 54 yards, which he hit against Louisiana Tech in 2012. Bertolet was 3-of-4 from 50 yards or longer for his career entering the season.
Bertolet missed a 49-yard attempt wide right late in the second quarter. He made a 24-yard field goal in the third quarter to give A&M a 27-10 lead.
A&M quarterback Kyle Allen completed 9-of-9 passes in the first quarter for 116 yards and two touchdowns.
A&M employed a new wrinkle to get the ball in the hands of freshman receiver Christian Kirk. He took the direct snap twice in the first half, gaining a combined eight yards.
Backup running back James White returned for the first time since suffering an undisclosed injury in the season opener against Arizona State.
Linebacker Otaro Alaka (undisclosed) and receiver Jeremy Tabuyo (undisclosed) did not play. Receiver Speedy Noil missed his second straight game to what the SEC Network termed an ankle injury.
Texas A&M 30, Mississippi State 17: Complete coverage
